intro: Georgina cervantesii, commonly known as the Cervantes's georgina, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
